info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 10:40AM EDT until May 15 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Wakefield VA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Virginia...
James River At Cartersville affecting Goochland, Powhatan and Cumberland Counties.
James River At Richmond Locks affecting Henrico and City of Richmond County.
For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks, Richmond Westham, Cartersville...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...James River at Cartersville.
* WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Overflow onto flood plain along left bank.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 15.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 20.2 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.0 feet on 09/18/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW MORNING

area.areaDesc: Cumberland, VA; Goochland, VA; Powhatan, VA
